title: Pediatric Registered Dietitian
description:
Job Description-Registered Dietitian

The job description provides a consistent frame of reference of performance requirements and expectations for both the employee and the supervisor.

**Position Description:**

*Registered Dietitian*

The Registered Dietitian will work under the direction of the Assistant Vice President of Clinical Nutrition and Wellness and is responsible for the implementation of nutrition services for our residential boarding homes and medical clinics.

**New York Foundling:**

**Job Responsibilities:**

* Provide nutrition training and education for residential staff addressing issues of food safety, balanced meal planning and healthy snack alternatives as well as any special diets that residents may require.
* Provide nutrition demonstrations and trainings for young moms including portion control, exercise, overall healthy eating, food shopping and making simple meals.
* Provide one-on-one virtual nutritional counseling for parents and children in our medical clinics. The dietitian will assess their nutrition risk along with plan diet and recommendations. Follow ups according to the level of risk for each individual. Medical issues in this community are mostly overweight/obesity, selective eaters, diabetes, underweight/failure to thrive and high cholesterol/blood pressure.
* Conduct cooking demonstrations or other nutrition events for staff and residents
* Report to NYC office location one day per week to collaborate with team and supervisor.

**Functions:**

Provide nutritional counseling and support to at-risk clients

Continuously follow patients for ongoing nutrition support

Lead the educational initiative on healthy eating for staff, young mothers, pregnant teens and children.

Demonstrate various cooking methods for common foods for staff to implement in the residences.

Use the most current Dietary Guidelines for Americans to plan and implement nutrition education.

Make weekly site visits to residential facility to ensure dietary guidelines are followed.

**Additional qualifications for this position:**

Strong interpersonal skills

Ability to work with culturally diverse population.

Strong organizational skills

Strong computer skills

Flexibility, three remote days with one to two clinic days per month. One office day per week and one residential site visit day in the Bronx.

Ability to work as a team with five additional Registered Dietitians including another pediatrics dietitian.

All New York Foundling employees will have: a commitment to the Agency’s Mission, a track record of success in their field, agreement with the goals and philosophy of the Agency, and a commitment to excellence in all respects. Compensation package will be competitive and commensurate with experience.

**Educational Requirements*****:*** 

**\\*BA/BS**

RD license or RD eligible

Certified Dietitian/Nutritionist

Registered Dietitian Nutritionist (Or RD eligible)

* NYS Certification Dietitian-Nutritionist (preferred but can apply once hired)
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Computer literacy
* Experience working with children
* Strong knowledge of nutrition principles and dietary guidelines
* Food demonstration knowledge a plus
* Ability to conduct thorough patient assessments and develop appropriate diet plans
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to effectively educate and motivate patients
* Proficiency in using nutrition software or tools for meal planning and analysis
* - Strong organizational skills to manage a caseload of patients effectively.

title: Elementary/Middle School Classroom Assistant
description:
Classroom Assistant

VOICE Charter School (www.voicecharterschool.org) is an elementary and middle school located in Long Island City, Queens that serves students in grades K-8. We are located just minutes from Manhattan (two stops from the last subway stop in Manhattan on the F train) and Long Island City’s growing waterfront district, thriving arts community, and rapid residential growth. We combine rigorous academics with daily instruction in choral singing, thereby encouraging creative and critical thinking while improving academic performance. We are looking to identify extraordinary educators and administrators committed to urban education and high academic achievement who wish to join a dynamic learning community.

Our mission is to create a safe and healthy learning environment that will nurture, motivate and challenge all of our children to achieve the highest level of academic excellence and to develop into mindful, responsible, contributing participants in their education, their community and the diverse society in which we live.

What makes VOICE different?

At VOICE, it’s not just about the music. It’s about the people. It’s about what you can be. It’s about using your passion. It’s about relationships. It’s about having the opportunity to choose. It’s about caring for each individual child. Our teachers, administrators, students and parents come together to support our children’s education. We operate as part of a professional learning community that promotes collegiality, shared work, and unending reflection and growth. At VOICE, you will be pushed to become more.

We believe in efficacy. At the core of our academic culture is the idea that all students are capable of doing well in any discipline. At VOICE, all students will learn.

We support and develop the effectiveness of our teachers. We believe that teachers need time to collaborate to build their practice, so we provide them with over two hours of planning time a day, as well as additional days for curriculum development and training during the school year.

We promote participation in music and the arts. As music and art both help to develop problem solving and critical thinking skills and open children's imaginations, all VOICE students participate in daily activities in the arts, including rigorous choral training. We design our arts-integrated curriculum to bring joy to the lives of our children in order to provide them with the skills necessary to forge their own path.

All Faculty and Staff at VOICE:

* Love and nurture all of our students as they become deeply caring and responsible individuals
* Take personal responsibility for the performance and growth of each individual student as we understand that the progress of all students is directly under our control
* Work collaboratively
* Hold themselves to the highest standards
* Push and support themselves, their students, and their colleagues
* Proactively seek and incorporate feedback
* Help each individual child gain the opportunity to choose what his or her future will be

\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_\\_

Position Responsibilities:

The Middle School Classroom Assistant supports teachers in providing students in grades K-2 with a safe and healthy learning environment that will nurture, motivate and challenge all children to achieve the highest level of academic excellence and to develop into mindful, responsible, contributing participants in their education and communities.

Educational Activities

* Provide behavior management support
* Work with students one-on-one or in small groups to reinforce instruction
* Proactively identify student growth areas and implement collaborative problem-solving plans to address student lagging skills
* Serve as a substitute for teachers as necessary

School Culture Activities

* Support dean team by investigating incident reports, guiding students to solve their own problems, and holding students accountable for consequences and restorative work
* Supervise out of classroom settings such as arrival, transitions, lunch, and dismissal
* Lead activities during daily recess periods in all weather conditions
* Ensure playgrounds are safe and free of ice and snow by supporting snow removal and shoveling snow
* Support select after school opportunities such as concerts, ceremonies, dances, athletics, and detention
* Fully participate in opportunities for individual and school-wide professional development

Administrative Activities

* Correspond with families via telephone, written notes, and in-person communications
* Distribute classroom materials and complete other clerical tasks as needed by teachers and support staff

Position Qualifications:

Behavioral Qualifications

* Unwavering commitment to VOICE mission, vision, and values
* Models high standards of integrity, trust, openness, and respect for others
* Demonstrates integrity by honoring commitments and promises
* Operates and follows through on assigned tasks and projects under specific time constraints and by specified deadlines
* Is productive and carries fair share of the workload; focuses on quality and expends the necessary time and effort to achieve goals
* Seeks to understand and meet and/or exceed the needs and expectations of customers and clients; treats customers and clients with respect
* Builds and maintains positive relationships with team members
* Recognizes the constructive value of and embraces feedback
* Responds and adapts to developing challenges and obstacles when under pressure calmly and logically to develop working solutions in a timely manner
* Identifies and seeks to resolve and prevent problems
* Approaches new challenges as opportunities to improve skills and abilities, seeking advice and feedback to constantly improve
* Seeks opportunities for personal and professional learning

Skills and Knowledge

* Exercises discretion regarding sensitive personal and legal information
* Effectively prioritizes tasks in order to meet deadlines
* Responds to requests in a professional manner, even in difficult circumstances; provides accurate and timely service
* Works effectively and cooperatively with others to achieve goals
* Writes clearly and concisely; listens attentively to others and responds appropriately; takes into account the audience and nature of the information
* Verbally articulates progress against tasks clearly and concisely; communicates ideas, suggestions and concerns as well as outcomes and progress throughout the course of a task or project
* Regularly applies feedback and training outcomes to the work to grow continuously in and add value to the role
* Exhibits ability to identify and address issues
* Manages up and laterally by proactively providing supervisors and clients support and solutions to move work and projects forward
* Identifies and seeks to resolve and prevent conflicts with team members

Educational Background and Work Experience

* Associates or Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university preferred. Highschool Diploma required.
* Willingness to pursue NYS assistant certification
* Ability to lift at least 40 pounds

Applications are enhanced if candidates:

* Have one year of experience working in an office environment preferred
* Speak Spanish
* Have previous experience working with students
* Have previous experience working in contexts involving high-needs communities

Compensation and Benefits: The compensation for this position is $22.00 an hour. We offer a comprehensive benefits package, including participation in the TransitChek program and partial reimbursement for monthly commuting expenses, gym reimbursement, participation in the 403B retirement program, cultural enrichment reimbursements and many opportunities to get to know your VOICE colleagues!

How to Apply: Please submit an electronic application (including a VOICE-specific cover letter and resume) here.

VOICE Charter School is an Equal Opportunity Employer. In its employment decisions, VOICE does not discriminate on the basis of an applicant or employee’s race, color, religion, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, national origin, disability, veteran status, unemployment status, or any other status protected by law.

title: Marketing Assistant/ Payroll
description:
**The Company**

Core Health Management is a Healthcare Management Service Organization (MSO) that provides all administrative support for behavioral health and healthcare practitioners including scheduling, billing, credentialing, recruiting, onboarding, and other related administrative tasks.

**The Position**

The HR Marketing Assistant supports our employee population by providing the structure, care and development needed for individual employees to be successful in their own careers, which in turn contributes to the overall growth and success of the company.

As the HR Marketing Assistant, you will be providing administrative support in the Human Resources Department with a concentration in payroll and marketing. We are looking for someone who is tech-savvy, experienced, or highly interested in web design and marketing, familiar with our HRIS, and experienced with running payroll for a small to medium sized company (1-100 employees).

The position has the following responsibilities:

-Monitor weekly timesheets. Review timesheets that are not approved. Assist employees with timekeeping inquiries, personnel inquiries, monitoring of staff on leave and conducting appropriate follow-up with employees who are expected to return to duty. Maintains the integrity and confidentiality of HR files and records.

-Implement strategies to promote content through social media and other web-based outlets. Maintain and update social media communications of all types including Facebook, Instagram, company websites, and more. Proofread and edit blog content.

-Compensation and Benefits: run bi-monthly payroll, coordinate health insurance benefits and enrollment, retirement plan benefits, and other related benefits.

-Performance management, employee relations, recruiting and retaining talent, including posting job ads and follow-up on job applications, onboarding and training, coaching and counseling.

-Maintain highly organized workflows and provide excellent internal customer service, which will be critical in ensuring that all companies function smoothly and effectively so that each company can meet their strategic goals.

-Support employee engagement, organize HR team events and activities.

-Encourage inclusion, well-being, and positive employee experiences – be mindful of the impact on colleagues & represent a level of excellence.

-All other duties assigned by the supervisor.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $50,000.00 - $60,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

* 8 hour shift

* Payroll: 1 year (Required)

title: Psychotherapist, Private Practice, LPC, LCSW, PsyD, PhD
description:
Hamlett Health Psychotherapy is offering an exciting opportunity to be part of a boutique group practice in Madison, NJ. Hamlett Health Psychotherapy believes therapy should be accessible and provide a safe, supportive space where clients feel heard and understood, empowering them to navigate life’s challenges with resilience and self-awareness.

We are currently seeking a Part-Time Psychotherapist Licensed in NJ (LPC, LCSW, PsyD, PhD). The candidate will be providing virtual therapy services for our practice as we expand and accept new clients. The position starts as part time W2 hourly.

**About Us**

Hamlett Health is a growing group practice with a client-centered approach, offering customized care that respects the client’s personal history and circumstance’s; designing relevant treatment plans that can be adjusted to be effective as the client’s situation and goals progress. At Hamlett Health Psychotherapy, we help the client break the cycle that is keeping them from experiencing a life they are excited to live.

**Our Vision**

To create a therapy practice built on ensuring clients feel heard and valued. As clinicians we will walk alongside our clients as they navigate life’s challenges, providing encouragement and understanding in order to heal and grow.

**Shifts**

· Expected hours: 5 – 15 per week

· Mornings, Weekdays and Weekends

· Requiring 3 shifts, one night, one day, one additional

**By joining our team, you will be provided with:**

* Flexible schedule
* Competitive compensation
* Paid Administrative Time
* Steady stream of referrals
* Team support
* Electronic health records
* Marketing
* Billing services
* Growth opportunity
* Flexible scheduling, including ability to work remotely
* HIPAA-compliant professional e-mail
* PsychologyToday Listing with Office

**Qualifications**

* Candidate must have a Master's or Doctoral degree in psychology, counseling, social work, or a related field.
* The ideal candidate has their Clinical License in the state of New Jersey
* Experience in providing counseling services to individuals
* Strong interpersonal and communication skills
* Ability to empathize and connect with clients
* Knowledge of various therapeutic techniques and interventions
* Ability to maintain confidentiality and adhere to ethical guidelines
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team
* Flexible and adaptable to meet the needs of clients

**Application Process**

Please email all inquiries to Jackie@HamlettHealth.com with the following

* Your updated resume
* Your cover letter

For more info on our practice, check out our website: For more info on our practice, check out our website HamlettHealth.com

description:
Nassau Psychology is a vibrant, growing, private group practice with locations in Nassau County. We are seeking a full-time administrative assistant who demonstrate the heart and skills needed to help our valued clients and who want to be a part of a flourishing team.

\\*THIS IS NOT A REMOTE POSITION\\*

-Process referrals and schedule client appointments

-Verify insurance benefits and process coordination of insurance benefits

-Creating and submitting insurance claims, payment posting

-Batch invoicing and billing

-Process ERAs and EOBs

-Follow up on claim denials and appeals

-Account Receivable follow up

-Enter new client data, processing forms

-Retrieve, send and process e-mails

-Answer phone calls

-Complete faxing/scanning tasks

-Support Admin team, Therapist team and Leadership team in day-to-day tasks

Our NPPC employees enjoy the benefits of:

* Medical, dental, and vision benefits for full time staff (32 hours per week)
* Paid sick leave
* Paid holidays
* Paid time off

title: Retail Sales Associate
description:
**Join Us Today!**

Unlock Your Sales Potential at AAA Club Alliance! Are you passionate about delivering exceptional service while driving sales success? Join our team and be part of a dynamic retail environment where every interaction counts. Don't wait any longer—apply now and take the next step towards a rewarding career!


**Work-Life Balance:**

* **No Sundays** : Enjoy a consistent schedule with no work on Sundays.
* **Convenient Hours:** With store hours from Monday to Friday, 9AM to 5:30PM, and Saturday, 9AM to 3PM; **37.5 Hour Work Week**
* **Paid Holidays** : Celebrate eight paid holidays throughout the year.
* **Generous Paid Time Off** : Accrue over three weeks of paid time off during your first year.
* **Paid Volunteer Time Off** : Make a difference in your community with paid time off to volunteer.

**Rewards and Benefits:**

* **Competitive Compensation** : A competitive hourly rate, based on experience and location.
* **Monthly Incentive Plan** : Drive your success with a monthly incentive plan tailored to reward your individual performance.
* **AAA Premier Membership** : Enjoy complimentary AAA Premier level membership benefits.
* **Medical, Dental, Vision, and Prescription Coverage** : Take care of your health with our comprehensive benefits package.
* **Tuition Reimbursement** : Invest in your future with our tuition reimbursement program.
* **401(K) Plan** : Save for your retirement with our company-matched 401(K) plan, up to 7%.

**What You'll Do:**

As a Retail Sales Associate, you'll play a vital role in delivering exceptional service to our members while promoting AAA products and services. Your responsibilities will include:


* **Sales Excellence:** Consistently up-sell and cross-sell AAA products such as new memberships, credit cards, and insurance referrals.
* **Travel Planning:** Assist members in planning domestic travel vacations, including car rentals, hotels, vacation packages, maps, tour books, and triptiks.
* **Customer Service:** Answer incoming overflow calls for Roadside Assistance during peak call volumes, ensuring timely and efficient service delivery.

**Minimum Qualifications:**

* **Sales Savvy:** Bring a minimum of six (6)months of sales and customer service experience to the table, demonstrating your ability to drive results and exceed expectations.
* **Communication Skills:** Showcase effective written and oral communication skills, essential for engaging customers and articulating the value of AAA memberships.
* **Tech Proficiency:** Navigate multiple websites and programs with ease, demonstrating proficiency in computer skills essential for multitasking in a fast-paced retail environment.
* **Geography Skills** : basic geography knowledge is beneficial.
* **High School Diploma/GED** : A minimum educational requirement to join our team.
* **Satisfactory Background:** Satisfactory pre-employment and post-employment screening results including criminal, drug, and state and/or vendor specific screenings. This may include ability to obtain necessary Membership license (or others) as required to perform the essential functions of the position.
AAA Club Alliance (ACA) is an equal opportunity employer.


Our investment in Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion:
  

  

At ACA, we are committed to cultivating a welcoming and inclusive workplace of team members with diverse backgrounds and experiences to enable us to meet our goals and support our values while serving our Members and customers. We strive to attract and retain candidates with a passion for their work and we encourage all qualified individuals, regardless of race, color , gender, identity, veteran status, sexual orientation, physical ability or national origin, to apply.  



**Job Category:**

Sales

title: Telehealth Mental Health CounseIor
description:
Nassau Psychology PC is a vibrant, established, well-run, group psychotherapy practice in Nassau County. We're looking for a licensed Clinical Psychologist, Licensed Mental Health Counselor (LMHC), Licensed Clinical Social Worker (LCSW), Licensed Master Social Worker (LMSW), or Licensed Marriage Family Therapist (LMFT), Mental Health Counselor (MHC-LP) to join our team Remote or In Office!

We offer healing, hope and possibilities for adults, adolescents, children and couples through psychotherapy and psychoeducation that recognize the value, strengths, and resources of all we serve. We are seeking experienced mental health providers who demonstrate the heart and skills needed to help our valued clients and who want to be a part of a flourishing team. Nassau Psychology helps therapists focus on therapy by taking care of the business side of a clinical practice.

We provide supervision, referrals, marketing, full billing and scheduling services, administrative support, beautifully furnished office suites and a fun and cohesive team of therapists. The Position is fee for service with reimbursement for any late cancellations and no shows. *This opportunity is ideal for the highly skilled therapist who would like to work in a thriving group practice setting while enjoying a full-spectrum compensation package including competitive pay, medical, dental & vision benefits , 401k matching, paid sick leave, professional development funds - - without the work, headaches, or financial investment of running a business.*

As a group, we strive to provide psychotherapy that deepens our clients understanding of themselves and their relationships. To that end, we use psychodynamic, gestalt, and family systems theories to deepen our work. At the same time, we strive to provide quick symptom relief, integrating the use of CBT, mindfulness and other practices in our work as well. We regularly consult with each other on cases and benefit from different perspectives. There are opportunities for peer-consultation, case conference and didactics as well.

**We are currently seeking full-time and part-time licensed therapists for our Wantagh, Cedarhurst, Rockville Center, and Remote locations.**

Part Time 16+ client hours per week including 4 evenings, or 3 evenings and Sunday for those who wish to work on Sunday.

We are looking for therapists who can see diverse client populations and presenting issues. Experience working with couples is a plus, as well as experience working with children, but not a requirement. Ideal candidates possess the ability to conceptualize a case, understand underlying motivation and use a treatment model to drive treatment.

**Benefits for Licensed Therapists:**

* Bi-monthly automatic bank deposits based on all sessions provided during the previous 2 weeks - (no need to wait for protracted insurance reimbursement)
* All credentialing with insurance companies is done by the practice
* All new patients are on boarded by our New Patient Coordinators (all paperwork, forms etc. are completed by our staff) so you can focus on doing therapy
* We have a very steady referral stream of clients to easily fill your caseload
* All billing of insurance is handled on your behalf
* Feel at ease in well-appointed therapy rooms
* Weekly consultation group
* Opportunities to offer supervision
* Dedicated clinical support and group consultations
* Thriving and connected professional team with year-round social events, sharing each other's successes and milestones and professional growth opportunities

**Minimum Requirements for Licensed Therapists:**

* Master's degree and independent professional license in New York State (including Licensed Mental Health Counselor, Licensed Clinical Social Worker and Licensed Clinical Psychologist).
* Availability for afternoon / evening work is helpful. Weekend availability is a plus. Part-time or full-time work available.
* Currently, we are not considering applicants who are an Associate or Provisional level of license.
* Enrollment on insurance panels is welcomed, but not required.

**For more information about our practice, you can visit our website:**

www.nassaupsychology.org

To apply, please forward a cover letter of interest and resume to the email linked to this posting. You will then be emailed a list of questions - and your responses will help us determine the next steps in our process.

Nassau Psychology is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Pay: $40.00 - $50.00 per hour

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Employee assistance program
* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Health savings account
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Parental leave
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Experience:

* Psychotherapy: 1 year (Required)

License/Certification:

* LCSW, LMHC, LMFT, MHC-LP, LMSW, MFT-LP (Required)

Work Location: One location

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Pay: $30.00 - $55.00 per hour

Expected hours: 15 – 38 per week

Benefits:

* 401(k)

title: American Girl NY - Asset Protection Associate (security license required)
description:
**CREATIVITY IS OUR SUPERPOWER.** It’s our heritage and it’s also our future. Because we don’t just make toys. We create innovative products and experiences that inspire, entertain and develop children through play. Mattel is at its best when every member of our team feels respected, included, and heard—when everyone can show up as themselves and do their best work every day. We value and share an infinite range of ideas and voices that evolve and broaden our perspectives with a reach that extends into all our brands, partners, and suppliers.

**The Team:** The Part-Time Under Asset Protection Associate position is part of the American Girl New York City retail store team.

Weekend availability required.

This position is 20 hours/week.

A valid NYS Security License is required.

**The Opportunity:**  The American Girl New York City retail store is looking for a dynamic individual as a Part-Time Asset Protection Associate, who is committed to maintaining a safe environment for American Girl customers and employees, as well as, safeguarding company assets. The individual we seek is able to multi-task, has outstanding communication skills, and exhibits a high level of compassion and understanding while maintaining a professional detachment.

**What Your Impact Will Be**

Maintain safe environment for American Girl customers/guests and store employees by monitoring/correcting safety concerns and controlling/guiding customer traffic when needed.  
Provide external and internal customer service in a positive, friendly and professional business manner and the skill set to diffuse escalated situations.  
Prevent the loss of company assets through surveillance, conducting employee package checks and trash checks and is knowledgeable of civil and criminal laws pertaining to retail security.  
Serve as a safety mentor for store employees; lead by example.

**What We’re Looking For:**

One to two years of loss prevention, law enforcement, criminal justice, military or security experience, preferred.  
State specific license, if applicable.  
Working knowledge of Microsoft Word, Excel and Outlook Software programs, preferred.  
Demonstrated ability working with a broad and diverse work force and customer base, including working with children, preferred.  
Must be available to work evening, weekend, and holiday shifts.

The hourly rate for this position is between $19.00 - $19.00.\\*\\*Hourly rate is based on a candidate’s education, skills and experience.

title: E-Commerce Specialist
description:
We are looking for a high caliber, experienced and motivated e-commerce sales manager with experience growing channel sales program with partners like Amazon and Wayfair. This individual will be part of the Blossom E-Commerce Sales Team and will be responsible for managing the sales and marketing and promotional efforts of our key accounts, primarily focused on our e-commerce business. You will work to grow our sales with current e-commerce partners as well as have the opportunity to establish new accounts.

**Key responsibilities** This role offers a unique opportunity to define, develop and grow Blossom e-commerce relationships with Amazon, Wayfair, Houzz and other big partners. Plus have the opportunity to drive the strategy and execution of NEW partnerships across national brands.

* Serve as a key member of the Sales team, focused on our largest revenue generating accounts.

Create, monitor, and optimize product listings on Amazon, Wayfair, and other third-party marketplaces.

* Gather insights from sales reports on which product listings work well, which items should be sold at other retailers, and how to optimize current listings.
* Monitor promotional opportunities provided by e-commerce retailers.
* Identify and promptly react to marketplace issues, e.g., suspended or suppressed listings, unwanted attribute changes, inventory issues, copyright/trademark/patent infringement, etc.
* With the guidance of Amazon consultants, improve the performance of the brand by optimizing reviews, SEO, Buy Box, pricing and inventory availability between Seller Central (FBA) and Vendor Central.
* Identifying trends and watching for best sellers, performance indicators, and growth opportunities in our categories
* Preparing monthly sales reports by analyzing marketplace trends, retail sales, and account activity across our account portfolio
* Effectively manage all vendor partnerships in an attentive and professional manner
* Build and action retail promotions to drive growth and achieve maximum profitability.

**What You Contribute:**

* 3+ years of experience with sales, business development and marketing experience in the e-commerce space, working with key online retailers like Amazon and/or Wayfair.com and CastleGate.
* Demonstrates excellence with Excel.
* 3 + years of e-Commerce experience
* Knowledge of sales reporting and data analysis
* Proactive personality and careful attention to detail
* Effective organizational skills and ability to prioritize in a fun, art filled, fast-paced environment.
* Ability to build strong internal/external relationships.
* Detail oriented! Product catalog updates and maintenance include adding new products, ensuring the accuracy of existing data, lots of spreadsheets, updating product images and videos, and finding opportunities to improve the customer shopping experience through improved product data.
* Bachelor's degree in business, marketing, sales or related field a plus!

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: Base pay with commission

Experience level:

* 3-5 years

title: Art Instructor (Part Time)
description:
**Description:**  

We are seeking a talented and creative Art Instructor who will inspire students to express themselves through the various mediums of art. You will be working with students from grades K-12, instilling in them a love for creativity and empowering them to use art as a form of self-expression. The ideal candidate will have a rich background in various artistic mediums, a passion for teaching, and the patience and dedication to foster a positive, inclusive, and engaging learning environment.
  
  

**Responsibilities:**  

1. Teach art classes to students from grades K-12, adapting teaching style and content to the appropriate grade level.
  
2. Develop comprehensive lesson plans that engage students in a variety of art mediums including but not limited to painting, drawing, sculpture, printmaking, and digital arts.
  
3. Foster a nurturing, creative, and inclusive environment for students to explore their artistic skills.
  
4. Evaluate and provide constructive feedback on student's work to help improve their techniques and overall creative expression.
  
5. Demonstrate art techniques and assist students in applying these techniques to their own work.
  
6. Organize and prepare students' artwork for school exhibits and community events.
  
7. Ensure all lessons and activities comply with safety protocols.
  
8. Stay current with the latest art education techniques and trends.
  
  

**Qualifications:**  

1. Bachelor's degree in Art Education, Fine Arts, or related field (Master's degree preferred).
  
2. Prior teaching experience or relevant work experience in a K-12 setting preferred.
  
3. Comprehensive knowledge and skills in various art mediums.
  
4. Ability to communicate effectively and clearly with students, parents, and colleagues.
  
5. Patience and dedication to cultivating an inclusive and engaging learning environment.
  
6. Ability to adapt teaching methods to suit different ages and abilities.

title: Purchasing and Inventory Control Manager
description:
The Purchasing and Inventory Manager is responsible for overseeing and managing the company’s supply chain and inventory operations to ensure that raw materials and packaging supplies are sourced efficiently, costs are minimized, and quality standards are met. This role includes maintaining optimal stock levels, negotiating with vendors, coordinating deliveries, and ensuring the production process runs smoothly to meet the demands of the food manufacturing process.

**Key Responsibilities**:**Purchasing**:

* **Vendor Management**: Identify, evaluate, and establish relationships with suppliers, negotiate pricing and contract terms, and ensure consistent quality and timely deliveries.
* **Sourcing**: Research and select new suppliers for raw materials, packaging, and other supplies, keeping cost-effectiveness and quality in mind.
* **Cost Control**: Negotiate competitive pricing with suppliers to optimize material costs without compromising quality or production timelines.
* **Purchase Orders**: Create and manage purchase orders based on production schedules and inventory levels, ensuring timely restocking without over-purchasing.

**Inventory Management**:

* **Stock Level Monitoring**: Maintain optimal inventory levels to support continuous production and minimize holding costs.
* **Inventory Audits**: Conduct regular physical inventory counts, resolve discrepancies, and ensure proper storage conditions to maintain product quality and safety.
* **Inventory Forecasting**: Use historical data and collaborate with production and sales teams to forecast material needs based on upcoming production plans.
* **Minimize Waste**: Implement inventory control procedures to minimize spoilage, waste, and loss due to over-ordering or inadequate storage.

**Logistics Coordination**:

* **Inbound Shipments**: Coordinate and track the arrival of raw materials and packaging, ensuring timely delivery in accordance with production needs.
* **Supplier Relationship Management**: Collaborate with suppliers to ensure efficient and cost-effective logistics for all materials.

**Compliance and Quality Control**:

* **Compliance**: Ensure all purchasing and inventory processes adhere to regulatory and industry standards, including food safety, storage, and transportation regulations.
* **Product Quality**: Work with quality control teams to ensure raw materials meet the company’s quality and food safety standards.

**Reporting & Analysis**:

* **Data Analysis**: Monitor and report on inventory levels, purchasing costs, supplier performance, and material usage, providing actionable insights to senior management.
* **Budgeting**: Develop and manage the purchasing and inventory budget, keeping costs within targets while maintaining production efficiency.

**Required Qualifications**:

* **Education**: Bachelor’s degree in Supply Chain Management, Business, or a related field.
* **Experience**: Minimum of 5 years of experience in purchasing, inventory management, or supply chain roles, preferably in a food manufacturing environment.
* **Skills**:
* Strong negotiation and vendor management skills.
* Proficient in inventory management software (e.g., ERP systems).
* Excellent analytical and problem-solving abilities.
* Knowledge of food safety regulations and quality control processes.
* Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.

**Preferred Qualifications**:

* Experience working with food vendors and managing complex supply chains.
* Certification in supply chain management (e.g., CPIM, CSCP).
* Familiarity with lean manufacturing principles and continuous improvement processes.

**Key Competencies**:

* Strong leadership and communication skills.
* Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines.
* Strategic thinking with a focus on cost efficiency and process improvement.
* Collaborative mindset, able to work with cross-functional teams.

title: Editorial App/ Social Intern
description:
**Highsnobiety** is a brand dedicated to the latest in style, culture, and the community pushing them forward. We don't just report on what's happening — we are shaping it. From industry deep dives to product curations to our very own in-house garments, our goal is to bring you not anything and everything, but only the best of the best on all fronts.  

And we want you to be a part of that!

  


Highsnobiety is looking for an **Editorial Intern** to assist our content manager and senior social media manager. The focus of this internship will be creating native "stories" and writing push notifications for the Highsnobiety app, as well as creating video content for the Highsnobiety social media team. The ideal candidate is extremely detail-oriented, creative, motivated, and interested in the world of luxury fashion and culture.

  


**YOUR MISSION:**


* Create engaging, timely content for the Highsnobiety app
* Film and edit content for the social media team
* Assist the Content Manager to strategize long term initiatives exclusive to the Highsnobiety app
* Participate in team brainstorms and content-planning sessions
* Support the Director of Social and Director of Editorial Operations on ad-hoc projects

  


**YOUR SKILLS:**


* Basic knowledge of video editing in CapCut
* Extremely detail-oriented and organized
* Able to write clean, pithy copy - strong writing skills
* Keen eye for engaging visuals
* Interested in creating video content
* A strong sense of what Highsnobiety represents. You should be plugged into popular culture with awareness of what's going in in fashion, music, and other elements of Highsnobiety's landscape
* Enthusiastic about working on new platforms with high growth potential within the company
* Currently enrolled in a university program that is linked to journalism, design, marketing, communication (or similar), or are a recent graduate
* Must be local to NYC and authorized to work in the US at least 3 days a week and come into our NY office twice a week (Tuesday and Wednesday)
* Practical experience and internships in similar companies are a plus

  


**WHAT WE OFFER:**


* Motivating, international and creative work atmosphere
* The opportunity to pro-actively shape a company and help build a global brand
* Hybrid office located in NYC


All interns earn a wage of $16 per hour.


*Highsnobiety is a global community of independent-minded creatives & professionals: Every perspective matters. That's why we're proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, ethnicity, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship status, marital status, disability, gender identity, gender expression or genetic information.*


* All applicants must be authorised to work in the US

title: Direct Support Professional (DSP)
description:
Are you energetic, caring, and passionate about working with young adults? Nassau Suffolk Services for Autism (NSSA), a private, non-profit agency providing exceptional services to individuals with autism and their families throughout Nassau and Suffolk Counties, is thrilled to offer exciting full-time opportunities for Direct Support Professionals (DSP) in our adult services program located in Commack. The role of a Direct Support Professional (DSP) goes far beyond being just a job; it is a rewarding career that creates a positive impact every day in the lives of people with intellectual disabilities and autism. As a DSP, you will play a vital role in ensuring the safety and well-being of those under your care, while also assisting them in achieving a fulfilling and enriched life.

**Responsibilities and Duties**

(include but are not limited to):

* Contribute to the development/implementation of necessary goals for vocational training, activities of daily living, self-help skills, leisure skills, fitness and community integration.
* Implement consumer objectives as outlined on their Day Habilitation Plan, Individualized Service Plans, and Behavior Support Plans.
* Assist/teach individuals with Autism to develop a level of independence in activities of daily living skills such as personal hygiene, grooming and dressing, toilet training, appropriate eating habits, care of clothing, social interaction and community skills development.
* Transporting individuals within our programs to and from various social or vocational events.
* Accurate completion of daily, monthly billing and other required documents.
* Attend training sessions. Participate in training classes to obtain required certifications in CPR and First Aid, SCIP and Medication Administration (AMAP) as needed

**POSITION AND ENVIRONMENTAL CONTEXT**

* The position requires the performance of tasks necessitating visual, manual, communicative, and analytic abilities within a team setting.
* The position requires that work be performed in multiply settings. Therefore, the ability to travel independently in the community may be required 25% of the time.
* The position represents the organization in many different forums. Professionalism in dress and conduct as well as appropriate representation of the agency is expected.
* Responsible for compliance with federal and state regulations.
* ***Physical demands; Ability to lift, push, pull and/or hold at least 100 pounds or more, bending, lifting and the ability to stand for at least eight hours at a time.***

**Qualifications and Skills**

* Minimum High School diploma
* Excellent oral and written communication skills
* Ability to respond to the needs of individuals with Autism in a friendly and nurturing way.
* Adequate physical strength required for physical activity and ability to handle possible crisis situations
* Ability to maintain neat and accurate records
* Clean and valid NYS driver’s license
* Registered Behavior Technician (RBT) a plus

**Benefits**

NSSA provides a professional and encouraging work environment that promotes collaboration and support to our employees. Our employees benefit from continuing training and development in autism, as well as Applied Behavior Analysis.

* Medical, Dental, Vision, and Supplement Insurance
* Vacation, Personal and Sick Time
* 403B Retirement
* Life Insurance
* Short/Long Term Disability
* Paid Family Leave
* Employee Assistance Program
* Flexible Spending Account
* Tuition Assistance on approved curriculum after 1 year of service
* Employee Discount Programs
* Legal Shield

Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: NSSA is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law. NSSA is a drug-free workplace.

title: Food Bazaar : Cashier,Produce,Customer Service,Grocery,Seafood,Meat,Dairy&Frozen,Bakery,Deli Clerk
description:
**[SUMMARY OF JOB]**

Provides prompt, efficient and friendly customer service. Responsible for accurately, efficiently, and politely checking out customer’s orders at the register. Must be able to answer customer questions, make recommendations and promote sales through suggestive selling. Must acquire full knowledge of all produce products and codes. Assists in loss prevention.

**[RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE]**

1. Provides prompt, efficient, and friendly customer service by exhibiting care, concern, and patience in all customer interactions and treating customers as the most important people in the store.

2. Smiles and greets customers in a friendly manner, whether the encounter takes place in the employee’s designated department or elsewhere in the store.

3. Works with co-workers as a team to ensure customer satisfaction and a pleasant work environment.

4. Checks out customers in an accurate and efficient manner using the correct scan or ring method. Perform cashier-customer transactions accurately in order to maximize customer satisfaction and minimize losses by handling all monetary transactions according to policy and procedures.

5. Maintains security and minimizes losses through awareness of pricing errors, coupons, checks, food stamps, WIC checks, credit card transactions, bottom of cart items and/or other interactions, reporting as necessary to the Front Coordinator and/or Store/Night Manager.

6. As necessary or upon request, must perform the following duties : clean front and register area, stock supplies and product (candy, cigarettes, baby formula, etc), retrieve shopping carts, miscellaneous cleaning, face or straighten shelves.

7. Re-shops merchandise to appropriate sections of the supermarket.

8. Maintain adequate supplies for customer and operational use.

9. Assists with bagging at the front end.

**[REQUIREMENTS]**

* Must have the ability to read, write, solve practical problems, and interpret instructions.
* Ability to do arithmetic calculations involving fractions, decimals and percentages.
* Have the ability to understand and follow verbal or demonstrated instructions; write identifying information; request supplies verbally or in writing.
* Operate register and scanner.
* Handle money, checks, and other media and distinguish between various denominations of currency.
* Lift and carry groceries up to 40 lbs.
* During checkout, must be able to : stand, bend, twist, reach, pull, push, and handle loads and resistances up to 20 lbs.

title: Automotive Detailer
description:
We are seeking a meticulous and dedicated Automotive Detailer to join our team at the car dealership. The Automotive Detailer will be responsible for ensuring that all vehicles on our lot are meticulously cleaned, polished, and presented to the highest standards. This role is crucial in enhancing the overall customer experience and maintaining the reputation of our dealership.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Vehicle Detailing:** Perform thorough interior and exterior cleaning of vehicles, including washing, waxing, buffing, and vacuuming, to ensure they are showroom-ready.
* **Interior Cleaning:** Clean and sanitize all interior surfaces, including upholstery, carpets, door panels, and dashboard, to remove dirt, stains, and odors.
* **Exterior Detailing:** Wash and polish the exterior of vehicles to remove dirt, grime, and debris, and apply protective coatings to enhance shine and durability.
* **Window Cleaning:** Clean windows, mirrors, and glass surfaces inside and outside of vehicles to ensure visibility and clarity.
* **Wheel and Tire Care:** Clean and polish wheels and tires to enhance appearance and remove brake dust and debris.
* **Detailing Supplies Management:** Maintain inventory of detailing supplies, including cleaning agents, polishes, and wax, and replenish as needed.
* **Quality Assurance:** Conduct thorough inspections of completed work to ensure that vehicles meet dealership standards for cleanliness and presentation.
* **Customer Interaction:** Interact with customers courteously and professionally when delivering cleaned vehicles, and address any concerns or requests they may have.
* **Work Area Maintenance:** Keep detailing bays, equipment, and tools clean and organized to ensure a safe and efficient working environment.

**Qualifications:**

* Previous experience in automotive detailing preferred, but not required; training will be provided.
* Strong attention to detail and commitment to delivering high-quality work.
* Ability to work efficiently in a fast-paced environment.
* Physical stamina and dexterity to perform repetitive tasks and work in various weather conditions.
* Excellent time management and organizational skills.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
* High school diploma or equivalent.

If you are passionate about cars and have a keen eye for detail, we invite you to apply for the Automotive Detailer position at our dealership. Join our team and contribute to creating exceptional experiences for our customers through impeccable vehicle presentation!

**Join our team and be a key player in the initial stages of creating a showroom-worthy finish for our clients' vehicles!**

title: Customer Sales Representative
description:
Are you enthusiastic about building a career in sales and eager to work with industry leaders? At MMG Solutions, we are a trusted partner for notable clients in the technology and telecommunications sectors, specializing in promoting and selling their products and services through in-person interactions. As a key player in the telecommunications industry, we help our clients significantly grow their profits by driving customer engagement, increasing sales volume, and expanding their market reach. We’re seeking a driven and ambitious individual to join our dynamic team as a Customer Sales Representative.

In this role, you’ll engage directly with customers, promoting our client’s products and services, overcoming objections, and closing sales. As a Customer Sales Representative, your day-to-day will involve developing your sales skills, providing excellent customer service, and gaining hands-on experience in a fast-paced, collaborative environment. We’re looking for someone with a positive attitude and a hunger for growth, ready to learn from our experienced team and accelerate their career within our company. If you’re motivated to advance your career as an Customer Sales Representative and thrive in a supportive, goal-oriented setting, we want to hear from you!

**Customer Sales Representative Duties/Responsibilities:**

* Engaging directly with potential customers, presenting product details, and addressing inquiries to build trust and foster relationships
* Presenting and promoting client products and services with expertise, skillfully applying product knowledge, and overturning objections to close sales successfully
* Resolving customer inquiries and complaints with professionalism and empathy, ensuring a positive experience, and maintaining the company’s reputation for exceptional service
* Tracking and analyzing daily customer interactions and sales activities, using insights to refine sales strategies, improve performance, and drive measurable growth
* Contributing to team development by coaching and mentoring colleagues in sales techniques, product expertise, campaign updates, and personal growth initiatives
* Collaborating with the Customer Sales Representative team, offering feedback on customer engagement, identifying opportunities for team improvements, addressing client expectations, and setting actionable goals

**Customer Sales Representative Requirements:** 

* High school diploma or equivalent; additional education or certifications are a plus
* 0-2+ years of experience in customer service, outreach, sales, hospitality or any customer-facing role
* Driven self-starter with strong organizational skills and a demonstrated ability to prioritize and manage multiple responsibilities effectively
* Optimistic and solutions-oriented mindset, able to tackle challenges with a positive outlook and a problem-solving approach
* Eager to learn and receptive to feedback, consistently striving for growth through constructive input from the management team
* Capable of working both independently and collaboratively within a team, contributing value while pursuing opportunities for career advancement within the Customer Sales Representative team

title: Director of Child Development (Exempt)
description:
ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS:

The Director of Child Development is responsible for coordinating and implementing all Childcare activities, in

addition to making sure the center meets all New Jersey State licensing and National Association for Education

of the Young Child (NAEYC) requirements. In addition, he/she must be willing to fulfill his/her responsibilities in

accordance with the Center’s Educational Philosophy.

ROLE AND RESPONSIBILITIES

 Act as Child Development Department Head. Coordinates and implements Childcare program directives as

assigned by senior staff. Develop and monitor curricula for the Childcare program.

 Ensure implementation of quality programming and monitors Head Teachers in overall program directives

and program functions. Supervise arrangement for extracurricular activities such as field trips, staff

development etc.

 Responsible for monitoring program budgets and process for Childcare expenditures. Monitors and

documents the progress, or lack thereof, of Childcare participants in educational and social development,

testing, attendance, and other related progress.

 Acts as representative of the Childcare department, at staff meetings and external meetings. Coordinates

department’s staff meetings and parent meetings. Supervises and coordinates staff development.

Responsible for ensuring the proper maintenance of the child development program facilities, equipment

and areas.

 Prepares all internal and external reports and ensures compliance with contractual obligations. Provides

important feedback to senior staff to ensure quality programming. Researches and integrates the most

innovative teaching methods for childcare. Ensure Belonging Childcare Center’s philosophy in child

development is accurately conducted and implemented.

 Ensure the safety and creation of a loving and caring environment for the children.

 Any other duties as assigned by the Supervisor.

title: Forklift Operator 2nd Shift
description:
**Company Description**  

Stratas Foods LLC is the leading supplier of fats and oils to the Foodservice, Food Ingredients and Retail Private Label markets in North America and is a producer of quality bulk and packaged dressings, mayonnaise and sauces. Stratas Foods was formed in October 2008 as a 50/50 joint venture between ACH Food Companies (ACH) and Archer Daniels Midland (ADM).


Manufacturing facilities are located in Dallas and Houston, TX; Decatur and Quincy, IL; Englewood, NJ; Fresno, CA; Nashville, TN; and Valdosta, GA. Corporate offices are located in Memphis, TN. We are committed to maintaining a progressive workplace by utilizing the ideas, skills and talents of all of our employees. We strive to make Stratas Foods a great place to work and are building a team capable of meeting our business goals.

 **Job Description**  

The forklift operator will be driving electric powered stand up industrial truck equipped with lifting devices such as forklift to push, pull, lift, stack, tier, or move products, equipment, or materials. This operation is to be performed keeping safety as a primary objective and following established GMP, Safety, Regulatory and Company procedures and policies.

**Responsibilities:**

* Move levers and press pedals to drive truck and control movement of the lifting apparatus.
* Position forks under loaded pallets, skids, boxes, products, or materials and transport load to designated area.
* Unload and stack material by raising and lowering lifting devices.
* Follow GMP’s and safety guidelines.
* Pick customer orders as required.
* Inventory material on work floor, and supply workers with materials as needed.
* Inspect trailers prior to loading and unloading product. Document onto proper form.
* Load and unload trucks and trailers.
* Load and unload materials onto or off of pallets, skids or lifting devices.
* Inspect truck daily and fill out operational checklists, recharge batteries.

 **Qualifications** **Education**: High School Diploma or equivalent

**Related Experience**: 1-2 years of previous related experience driving a Stand Up forklift

**Compensation**: $21.05

**Schedule:**


2nd Shift 3PM - 11:30PM with the possibility of overtime


Applicant must consent to a pre-employment drug screening, lift test (ability to lift 50 pounds) and physical evaluation.

 **Additional Information** **Physical:** Must be able to lift 50 pounds, climb stairs, lift, bend, kneel, stand for long periods of time, work in confined spaces, and work with heights.

**Sensory:** Must have the appropriate level of sensory acuity (visual, hearing, speaking, smell and touch) to be able to identify and react to normal, abnormal and alarm conditions (chemicals, temperature, etc.)

**Mental/Reasoning**: Must be able to logically and methodically work through and break down complex problems and processes to enable effective communication with all levels of the organization.


Stratas Foods is an equal opportunity employer and will not discriminate against any applicant or employee in any manner prohibited by law, including but not limited to, on the basis of race or color, religion, gender, age, genetic information, national origin/ancestry, mental or physical disability, family status/marital status, sexual orientation, military/veteran status, and any other legally protected status.



Pay Transparency Nondiscrimination Provision-The Employer will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the Employer’s legal duty to furnish information. 41 CFR 60-1.35(c)



Stratas Foods Applicant Request for Accommodation Form: https://www.stratasfoods.com/compliance


Stratas Foods California Privacy Rights Act Policy: https://www.stratasfoods.com/compliance

title: School Monitors & Subs
description:
Monitors are needed to supervise children and maintain order in the hallways and/or lunchrooms.


Typical duties include but are not limited to:


* Supervising children in a lunchroom or in hallways
* Helping children find seats and maintaining order
* Cleaning up minor spills on occassion
* Assisting younger children with their apparel
  

  

**Job Qualifications**  

Desired knowledge, skills and abilities include:


* Good general intelligence
* Abillity to be firm yet courteous
* Ability to get along well with children
* Some knowledge of first aid methods
* Good powers of observation
* Good physical condition

  

**Civil Service Title:** School Monitor

title: Arborist - Sales
description:
Almstead Tree and Shrub Care is a second-generation, family-owned arboriculture firm that has been offering environmentally conscious services the NY, NJ, and CT tri-state area since 1964. We are a TCIA accredited company that values our employee’s professional aspirations, career development, safety and quality of life.


We are looking for a passionate professionals who wants to enhance their career in tree care! We offer generous compensation, year-round work, paid time off, health and retirement benefits, inclusive company culture and so much more! If you are ready to enjoy going to work every day, come grow with us!


**Basic Function**


Service, maintain and continue to build a very well established territory. Provide quality and timely diagnosis and estimates for tree, plant health care, and lawn care for residential and commercial clients in the Southern Westchester County area..  



  

**Responsibilities**

* Visit clients and prospects to diagnose and monitor landscapes.
* Negotiate contract and bid proposals for residential and commercial customers.
* Develop and implement tree care, lawn care & plant health care programs.
* Set-up crews, supervise work being performed, and complete jobs to client satisfaction.
* Continually prospect for new business.
* Maintain a safe and controlled workplace and environment.
* Enforce company safety and training policies.
* Attend community and industry events to help promote our business.

**Requirements**

**Skills/Abilities**


* The proven ability to establish, maintain and grow a sales territory.
* Hands-on knowledge of tree, plant and lawn care.
* The ability to correctly and effectively diagnose and price various tree care treatments.
* The ability to prepare and present proposals.
* Major account management.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills/listening skills.

**Education/Training**


* Two or four year degree in Arboriculture, Forestry, Horticulture, Plant Science, Plant Pathology, Environment Sciences, Biological Sciences, or equivalent.
* Valid driver’s license.
* ISA certification mandatory, or the ability to secure certification within 90 days.

**Benefits**


We offer a competitive compensation package, $65,000 - $90,000 draw against commission, medical and dental plans with employer contribution, 401K retirement savings plan, paid time off, and more!


Almstead Tree & Shrub Care Company, LLC provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment.

title: Controller - Service Company
description:
Almstead Tree and Shrub Care Co. is a second-generation, family-owned firm established in 1964. We have four branch locations servicing commercial and residential clients throughout the NY, NJ, and CT tri-state area.


We are seeking a Controller, well-versed in the service industry, able to see the big picture while rolling up their sleeves on the day-to-day operations of the accounting department. Duties will include all aspects of general ledger accounting including primary participation in monthly and year end closing, budgeting, reporting and analysis.


The successful candidate for this position must be well organized with the ability to multi-task and to prioritize in a fast-paced environment. They must have an eye for detail and a high level of accuracy, strong oral and written communication skills with the ability to carry out tasks autonomously, as well as, collaboratively across all functional areas, with other departments and corporate entities. This individual should be dependable with good time management skills in order to meet deadlines in a timely and efficient manner.


**ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIES**


* Daily general ledger accounting, accounts payable, accounts receivable, commissions, and accounting for production
* Fixed assets and depreciation calculations
* Inter-company reconciliations, prepaids, accruals, interest and provision calculations
* Job costing for prevailing wage jobs, cost of services for our 3 service lines, equipment or supplies
* Taxes: state sales & use tax returns for all applicable states
* Monthly and annual general ledger close
* Monthly, quarterly and year-end financial reporting package preparation along with interim inter-company reporting as required
* Assist in the preparation of budgets and on-going maintenance of forecasts
* Development of new spread sheets and reports for analysis as needs arise
* Oversee a staff of 3 responsible for payroll and accounts payable

**Requirements**

* The ideal candidate will possess a bachelor’s degree in Accounting or Finance with 5+ years of experience in hands-on full cycle accounting in a service company.
* A well-organized professional with a great eye for detail and a high level of accuracy, as well as analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Reliable, strong time management skills, able to multi-task and prioritize projects and assignments to meet strict deadlines.
* Self-motivated and proactive to carry out tasks both autonomously and collaboratively with excellent communications and interpersonal skills.
* Excellent computer skills knowledge of MS Office applications, a high level of proficiency with Excel as well as QuickBooks.

**Benefits**


We offer a competitive compensation package, $115,000 - $150,000 based upon experience. Medical and dental plans with employer contribution, 401K retirement savings plan, paid time off, and more!

**Almstead Tree & Shrub Care Company, LLC provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment.**

title: Investment Director
description:
**About ARCHIMED**


With offices in Europe, North America and Asia, ARCHIMED is a leading investment firm focused exclusively on healthcare industries. Its mix of operational, medical, scientific and financial expertise allows ARCHIMED to serve as both a strategic and financial partner to healthcare businesses. Prioritized areas of focus include Biopharma Products, Consumer Health, Healthcare IT, In Vitro Diagnostics, Life Science Tools & Biologic Services, MedTech, and Pharma Services.


ARCHIMED helps partners internationalize, acquire, innovate and expand their products and services. ARCHIMED manages €8 billion across its various funds, including the largest healthcare-only private equity fund raised by a European-based General Partner. Since inception, ARCHIMED has been a committed Impact investor, both directly and through its EURÊKA Foundation.

**The Team**

* An international team (with more than 30 nationalities) with complementary education and experience in the investment, medical, scientific, strategic and operational sectors
* Composed of alumni from: INSEAD, Berkeley, Georgetown, Bocconi, HEC Paris, Ponts et Chaussées, ESSEC, Imperial College, Dartmouth, etc.
* Professional backgrounds: Private Equity (3i, Siparex, USS Ltd, Barings, capiton), Consulting (A.T. Kearney, Bain, McKinsey), M&A (Lazard, EY, KPMG, PwC), Industry (Biotronik, Cerba, Pharmacy, Veterinary)

### **Responsibilities**

* **Investment Strategy and Planning:**
+ Develop and implement the investment strategy in alignment with the firm’s objectives.
+ Identify and evaluate new investment opportunities.
+ Conduct market research and analysis to support investment decisions.

* **Deal Sourcing and Origination:**
+ Source and originate new investment opportunities through industry contacts, networking, and market research.
+ Build and maintain relationships with investment banks, brokers, and other deal sources.
+ Evaluate potential investments and present opportunities to the investment committee.

* **Due Diligence:**
+ Lead due diligence efforts including financial, operational, and legal assessments.
+ Work with internal and external advisors to conduct thorough due diligence.
+ Develop investment theses and valuation models.

* **Transaction Execution:**
+ Negotiate and structure investment transactions.
+ Manage the drafting and review of legal documents and agreements.
+ Oversee the closing process for investments.

* **Portfolio Management:**
+ Monitor and manage portfolio companies to maximize value creation.
+ Provide strategic guidance and support to portfolio company management teams.
+ Develop and implement exit strategies to realize returns on investments.

* **Team Leadership and Development:**
+ Lead and mentor junior investment professionals.
+ Foster a collaborative and high-performance team environment.
+ Promote continuous learning and professional development within the team.

**Requirements**

* **Education:**
+ Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Business, Economics, or related field. MBA or CFA preferred.

* **Experience:**
+ Minimum of 7-10 years of experience in private equity or in the Healthcare industry.
+ Proven track record of leading successful investments and managing portfolio companies.

* **Skills:**
+ Strong analytical and financial modeling skills.
+ Excellent negotiation and deal structuring capabilities.
+ Deep understanding of financial markets and investment strategies.
+ Exceptional leadership and team management skills.
+ Excellent communication and presentation skills.

* **Personal Attributes:**
+ High level of integrity and professionalism.
+ Strong strategic thinking and problem-solving abilities.
+ Ability to work under pressure and meet tight deadlines.
+ Proactive and self-motivated with a strong work ethic.

title: Mental Health Receptionist
description:
Nassau Psychology is a vibrant, growing, private group practice with locations in Nassau County. We are seeking a full-time administrative assistant who demonstrate the heart and skills needed to help our valued clients and who want to be a part of a flourishing team.

\\*THIS IS NOT A REMOTE POSITION\\*

Job responsibilities include, but not limited to:

-Process referrals and schedule client appointments

-Verify insurance benefits and process coordination of insurance benefits

-Creating and submitting insurance claims, payment posting

-Batch invoicing and billing

-Process ERAs and EOBs

-Follow up on claim denials and appeals

-Account Receivable follow up

-Enter new client data, processing forms

-Retrieve, send and process e-mails

-Answer phone calls

-Complete faxing/scanning tasks

-Support Admin team, Therapist team and Leadership team in day-to-day tasks

Our NPPC employees enjoy the benefits of:

* Medical, dental, and vision benefits for full time staff (32 hours per week)
* Paid sick leave
* Paid holidays
* Paid time off
* Paid Family and Medical Leave
* Thriving and connected professional team with year-round social events and professional growth opportunities
